newsitem.title: GREECE: Greek bonds down, depos, swaps stable in late trade.
newsitem.headline: Greek bonds down, depos, swaps stable in late trade.

text.p: Greek bonds were trading down late on Friday, especially FRNs 2000 and 2004, depos and swaps were stable and ecu/drachma was firmer with purchases of ecus for drachmas from Greek and foreign investors, dealers said.

"Bonds were down on sales from foreign investors because of a pan-European selling pressure on high-yield markets. Floaters 2004 were trading 40 basis points lower and fixed coupon bonds 2000 were down 30 basis points," a bond dealer at a foreign bank said.
Finance Minister Nikos Christodoulakis said Greece would auction about 200 billion drachmas of long-term bonds in March to cover expiries.
There are expiries of about 126 billion drachmas in early March and 80 billion drachmas at the end of the month, he said.
Long-term bonds could be seven-year FRNs, three-year fixed coupon bonds or five-year coupon bonds.
Greece has never issued or auctioned a five-year coupon bond in the past.
"The market did not react to the finance ministry's statement for an auction and the likely issuance of a five-year coupon bond because it had discounted the news," the bond dealer said.
Greek M3 money supply grew provisionally 13.8 percent year-on-year in January from 9.0 percent in December, overshooting the central bank's 6.0-9.0 percent target range for end-97.
"This is another disturbing fact for money market rates and consequently bonds," he added.
Another bond dealer, the fall in bond prices followed an earlier drop in the bourse, which closed down 4.65 percent on Friday.
Sales of T-bills expiring on Friday did not cover expiries of 500 billion drachmas, dealers said.
Depos and forex forwards were stable a state-bank dealer said.
"Money market rates were steady late on Friday and the Bank of Greece's intervention rate was held constant. Deposits and swaps were therefore stable," a dealer at a state bank said.
The central bank kept its intervention rate in overnight money unchanged at 11.90 percent.
The mark was quoted at 156.75/85 from Friday's 156.840 fix, the dollar at 265.27/37 drachmas from 265.500 and the Ecu at 304.42/52 from 304.360 drachmas.
The National Bank of Greece, the domestic money market's biggest player, quoted the following late rates:
** Overnight at 11.45-11.95

** Two weeks at 11.45-11.95
** Three weeks at 11.45-11.95
** One month at 11.45-11.95
** Two months at 11.35-11.85
** Three months at 11.25-11.75
** Six months at 11.00-11.50
** Nine months at 10.90-11.40
** Twelve months at 10.80-11.30
